alert.note: Alert for Casey; Lincoln (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 11 at 4:18PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Lincoln and northeastern Casey Counties through 445 PM EDT... At 418 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles northeast of Liberty, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of Lincoln and northeastern Casey Counties, including the following locations... South Fork, Crab Orchard, Kings Mountain, Jumbo, Ottenheim, Mount Salem, Broughtentown, Walltown, Geneva and Middleburg. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EDT for central Kentucky.
